title: A sleak, fun ride at the expense of a detailed plot
content: 2.5/4This is a very Good Friday night flick. You're home from work, and it's time to watch a movie. You don't want it to make you think, you just want good acting, lighting, direction, and cinematics, and no expenses on the plot. For that kind of night, this is a spectacular choice.First off, it's not at all that the plot is half-baked. There was no waste of paper writing this script. In John Wick, the plot comes in a half-portion. It is very simple and straightforward in an intriguing way. An oppressed ex-assassin is coping with the shame of his past-actions and the recent death of his wife. The last thing his wife gives him is a puppy. When the foolish son of his old crime-boss breaks into his house, kills the puppy, and takes off in Wick's Mustang..."Well I think I'm back!!"On another note, the actors really fit into their roles. Keanu Reeves, who is a veteran in stylized action sub-genre, really rocks Wick in much the same fashion he did Neo in The Matrix (1999). This time though, he takes on a much more cold, The-Man-In-Black type persona... a man of few words. The action sequences are quick, flashy, and all produce the same end result. It can get a tad monotonous after a while, but in the end it conveys John Wick as a character more. It shows that a broken man who has everything taken from him will have the most incentive to get to what he wants. Alfie Allen, although his character is never able to be presented in a likable, preforms his immature young adult criminal. Another very sublime detail that you might not pick up on is that the mob is very talky, profane, and excersises little patience, yet Wick is a thinker. John Wick is a character you can truly root for in his conquest to avenge his anguish.Cinematography proves another segway to the movie's stunning fluidity. Toward the beginning, Sela exaggerates very dark shades of black, and airy shades of white, giving the movie a very docile and harmless feel. As the plot unravels, you see the development of heavy greys kick in, and as the action sequences commence, neon and black become the dominant themes. It makes for a very tidy feature with slick fight sequences.Another item not usually found in this particular genre... a good balance of everything, from an editing standpoint right down to the acting. I was pleasantly suprised that John Wick had the delivery that it's predecessors seldom did.

title: The Matrix 4?
content: Keanu Reeves, is a problem. A really big problem. All of the characters that he plays, turn out to be Neo (The guy who saved us all from the machines in 'The Matrix'). They all even have the same face!!But seriously, the guy is perfect for a lot of the roles that he has won (The Matrix, Point Break, Speed), its just that its wearing a little thin now. One thing is for sure, other than a Razzie, Reeves wont ever be picking up an award.This film sees Reeves playing the titular part of 'John Wick'. We meet him just after he has lost his wife. Not in a shopping mall, or out on the beach silly....she has died very recently. There is something of a mystery around 'Wicks' history, who he is, what he does, where has he come from...but all those questions get answered throughout the film.The film asks little of Reeves. The action is blisteringly fast, and some of it is genuinely.....'Cool'. The gun fights and hand to hand combat are handled with a visual panache that I haven't seen in a few years. Chad Stahelski and his team certainly have a firm grasp of how a 'fight' should be conducted. The great thing about having an action film starring Keanu Reeves, is that with all the action taking place, there leaves little room for Reeves to talk. He really says only a hand full of words in this film.Dog lovers be ware, there is a scene on par with Mad Max 2. You have been warned, and you will end up hating Alfie Allen even more than you do watching Game Of Thrones.A classic, by no means, but this is the kind of film that you can disappear into, watch, and never think about again. I don't think I will ever watch it again, it was a perfect 'Throw away' film.A good waste of 2 hours on a Sunday night.

title: Keanu Reeves doens't disappoint bringing us a great action franchise
content: Reeves brings it all in this non-stop action movie. His acting, weapon handling both guns and knives, and his martial arts makes him one of the greats especially knowing that he does most of his stunts. Stallone, Bruce, Bronson, Arnold, Gibson, Norris, Seagal, Cruise and even Van Damme have nothing on Reeves.John Wick has strong characters, plot, layers and pace. It will be a movie you want to see more than once.

title: ***Warning****: A bit of spoilers! Pure Action film
content: John Wick is a full on action movie. I wouldn't go into the plot of the movie. However, I will share my point of view as a critic:Positive: 1. The surprise element of the movie was John's old friend Marcus. The character gives a very good support to John and we get to know this only when he prevents John's death.2. The music used during the Action scenes was very good approach.3. The movie is very stylish overall.Negative: 1. Firstly, I was expecting some fist fight or any martial fight. There was two fights in the movie without the use of Gun. However, these fight were for very short duration.2. Lots and lots of shooting. At one point of time, I got the statement that John Wick is a very good hit-man or as they call Boogeyman. So, killing every mobs throughout the movie was a bit boring.3. At the end, if John wick had taken the breed of the dog which was killed, then it would have been very good.

title: Masterpiece of action films
content: The first John Wick is an absolute masterpiece of action cinema. With 3 additional films already released most people who didn't check this out when it was first released don't understand how explosive this film was when it showed up in theaters. There's been decades of action films but this one was just different. Every action set piece was executed perfectly and while it clearly a work of fiction and essentially a grounded superhero film in style, it's realistic in its approach to the film genre. Reeves took himself to another level in preparation for all these films but this is the one that set the bar for not just the remaining films in the series but for action films in general. The gun play is top notch, the hand to hand combat is fluid yet there is a struggle between combatants which gives it the realistic feel.I recommend the entire film series and each one just ups the ante as they go on but the first one is the most important action film since the 1980s.

title: It brought a tear to my eye...
content: Finally! An actual action movie with good action in it and an absolute diamond in the fluff. Instead of the usual Hollywood action films as of late, they managed to not sacrifice quality for wokeness-diversity-oppression-de-jour.This needs to be cancelled immediately.

title: Just Above Sick
content: Keanu Reaves after a long time. It is always good to see him. Normal acting, OK direction but the script/story was not digested. The film comes with an old approach action based plot.And you always know when someone gets out there to take revenge what happens. Some good Jiu Jitsu moves and close combat gun shots can be seen. Max Payne flashed through my mind while watching the film.It was broken in between in many ways where you will just say does it really happen or why and how did this happen.I would say its just an average film and you can watch it for once and enjoy the action.

title: Gun fight
content: Trust me when I tell that this one is great,I had to repeat watching it again and it was not a waste of time.john dosent stop kiling.if you are in to gun fight then I will recommend this one to you. Theres alot of violence which make this movie so interesting to watch.John retires from the business of being an assassin,but after the death of his wife fro an illness John has nothing to live for,not until he receives a puppy as present from his wife.Trouble comes knocking on his door when bugler's stole his car and kill his dog which is the only thing his wife left for him by doing this unleashes the sleeping beast inside him.

title: Bad ass movie
content: He's awesome! He's shoots as slick as he dresses. This movie is fast paced and fun! Nothing compares.

title: A Great Action Movie!
content: I just want to say how much I enjoyed this movie. It is now one of my all time favourite movies. If you like this genre of movie then you simple must watch it.

title: Negative Reviews are so missplaced
content: This is legitimately one of my favorite movies. I don't understand the negative reviews here. I think people were expecting character/plot development. This is not that. This is a revenge movie. This is THE revenge movie.A good revenge movie needs a few things: a believable cause for revenge, a hateable baddie, and great action sequences. Without giving spoilers (just watch it already though), I feel like this movie has strong checks all of these boxes. If you view this movie through this lens, there is no way you will be disappointed. The people who didn't like this must have been expecting a romantic comedy lol.Gun play in this movie is some of the most accurate and interesting you will find. Reloads happen often, misses happen on occasion, and fighting happens seamlessly. Keanu allegedly did something like 97% of the stunt work for this movie after spending months training in various martial arts and firearms. If you don't believe it, youtube Keanu at the range. I mention this because it is evident in the seamless cinematography that can be captured because the direct can have wide hand-to-hand and firefight shots.Watch this movie and give a review so we can get the score higher. Needs to be in the 9s for sure.

title: Keanu fan
content: A simple story executed to perfection from.start to finish in every way and every detail. One of my all time favourites

title: Solid
content: John Wick delivers a heavy dose of nice action sequences wrapped around a minimalist but effective storyline, as the main character gets dragged back into his old life in the underworld. Lacking in any real standout moment or line, it feels almost utilitarian in spite of its style and tongue in cheek setting. As such it ends up being more entertaining than memorable, and that's not such a bad thing.

title: The Matrix done right
content: John Wicks simplicity is what brings this movie from a minor league to a major league. John Wick in its glory gives us as viewers eye candy to watch over and over. I'm rating this action film high because this is one of the very few action movies I can watch over and over. It does have its shortcomings however. John Wick fails to deliver new action thrills and sticks with the same old movie tropes that we have become accustomed to. Just as The Matrix set a tone for this "almost masterpiece" it suffers from "I've seen that before, oh, but that's a great scene" I recommend John Wick for people who like action and a simple plot. Thank you for reading!

title: Entertaining Comic Book Absurdity
content: It's a lucky thing for Mr. Wick that no one taught the Russians how to shoot.

title: 1 star cause 0 is not available
content: many times i have found myself to strongly disagree with the rating of a movie in IMDb but not as much as this one...7.3 from 68.000 voters? is this a joke? there is no point at all watching this film unless you have two hours of your life to waste..the film is inadequate from every aspect...i guess if someone gives me tomorrow a camera to shoot and a pencil to write the scenario of a film the outcome will be more or less the same. i am sorry for what i am about to say...but this is what comes in my mind every time i get so disappointment from a movie that has so high rating but mine is far far below. I believe that the IMDb should introduce two different rating categories... one for the citizens of US and one for the rest of the world.

title: Keanu Reeves gives his best performance in years in a strong action spectacular.
content: Former assassin, John Wick (Keanu Reeves), has left behind his criminal past in favor of a quiet life with his wife, Helen (Bridget Moynahan). When Helen dies of a terminal illness five years later, John is devastated, but his wife posthumously arranged for a beagle puppy named Daisy to be delivered to John after her death. John bonds with the dog and allows John to feel still connected to his wife. When Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen), the spoiled, sadistic, arrogant son of crime boss Viggo Tarasov (Michael Nyqvist) takes a liking to John's '69 Mustang following a chance encounter at a gas station, Isoef makes an offer to buy the car which John flatly refuses. Later that night Iosef and his two thugs break into John's home killing Daisy and stealing John's car. After burying Daisy, John sets out on a path of vengeance as he chases Isoef through the criminal underworld while Viggo tries to protect Isoef by placing a contract on John.Written by direct-to-dvd action screenwriter Derek Kolstad of One in the Chamber and The Package, the foundation for John Wick began under the title Scorn with Kolstad seeking to evoke classic revenge and film noir classics with contemporary action stylings. Initially intended for a much older leading man (as popularized by Liam Neeson in the Taken films) the movie was rewritten and shown to Keanu Reeves who soon signed on. Reeves then contacted stunt specialist, Chad Stahelski and David Leitch (whom Reeves had worked extensively with on The Matrix films) hoping they'd wish to direct the film. Stahelski and Leitch jumped at the chance to work on the project with Reeves and the film when released ended up doing nearly double the expected box office that was projected and became critically acclaimed with word of mouth and advanced screenings making John Wick a dark horse that launched the directing careers of Stahelski and Leitch and was hailed as Keanu Reeves big comeback.While Keanu Reeves had major successes in the 90s with endearing classics like Point Break, Speed, and of course The Matrix, Reeves had stepped away from headlining major films following the end of the then Matrix Trilogy and the so-so performance of Constantine. While there were outliers such as The Day the Earth Stood Still remake and 47 Ronin (which originated as a supporting role but became a second lead following highly publicized reshoots) most of Reeves work had been in smaller scale productions or independent films. John Wick is without a doubt the strongest performance from Keanu Reeves since his turn as Bob Arctor in A Scanner Darkly in 2007. Reeves, despite a reputation for a stilted delivery, is very well utilized with his performance one of few words and more of facial expressions and body language with the opening scenes showing Wick's grief for his lost wife that culminates in the delivery of Daisy following her death truly heart wrenching scenes that make you invested in John as a character and helps you bond with the relationship between him and Daisy. And in addition to the physical performance, Reeves is at the top of his game in the action scenes doing approximately 90% of his own stunts and coupled with the strong directorial style of Stahelski and Leitch the action flows smoothly with minimal cuts and expertly crafted and timed choreography.The movie features a fantastic supporting cast with Alfie Allen an effectively hateful villain whose Iosef Tarasov is absolutely loathsome as the entitled preening sadist who serves as the impetus for John's rampage, the late Michael Nyqvist is also really strong playing Iosef's father Viggo whose controlled carefully planning crime boss makes a formidable antagonist for John to square off against. The movie also features some great turns by Willem Dafoe, Adrianne Palicki, John Leguizamo, Ian McShane, Bridget Moynahan, and Lance Reddick who add some strong personality to their characters and add to the richness of the world developed in the film. John Wick has some of the best world building I've seen in an action film with an established order based around this mysterious hotel called The Continental that serves as a neutral haven for the high end criminal element with its own monetary system of gold coins and an established code that when broken leads to undesirable consequences.The one point of criticism you can give this movie is that it's third act feels a little disjointed with the movie having seemingly come to its destination only for an additional climax to take place. While the action is still on point and the acting is still strong, it feels like the narrative flow could've been smoothed out by tying these two climactic sequences together into one rather than winding down from one only to jump into the other.John Wick is a white knuckle ride that despite its budget being on the lower end of the spectrum gives its audiences some of the most exhilarating and thrilling sequences in modern action cinema. Reeves gives his best performance in years and effortlessly handles both the action and acting needed for this protagonist, and a supporting cast of notable character actors brings life to this elaborate world and underworld created for the movie. While the plot does hiccup a little thanks to an additional climax, the movie has enough goodwill to make it a solid addition to any action fans required viewing list.

title: Bloody brutal non-stop flick
content: John Wick leaves you breathless from the amount of action and killing. If you enjoy simple stories with a lot of guns, killings, and simple dialog, this movie is for you.These stupid spoiled rich Russian kids unknowingly attack John Wick, and start the fuse that leads to massive unbridled mayhem in the city. Wick is an assassin who cannot be defeated, apparently, since they've made a John Wick 2. But it's not for wont of trying because boy do the bad guys through everything at him including the kitchen sink.Keanu Reeves does a good job of being stoic, every so often throwing out clichÃ© lines as he's killing people non stop. I loved his interaction with his associate Wilem Defoe, which was a highlight of the movie.The story is simple. The plot is not complicated. the action is heart stopping. If you like these kinds of movies, you won't be disappointed. Good luck - be prepared for the ride.

title: non-stop action thriller
content: So after his dog and wife die, and after his car is stolen John Wick(Keanu reeves) gets angry, comes out of retirement, and spends the whole movie killing mobsters with action music in the background...This movie was non-stop action, almost literally...it was a great movie and lots of big name actors would did a tremendous job. Best action film probably in the last 5 years...not the best movie all round, but for pure action, this takes top grades. Probably my favourite Keanu movie, even better than The Matrix. This movie has a few twists but it is very predictable. Which doesn't matter because its how he gets from start to finish that is worth the ride, not the story.

title: Scratches the action itch
content: Much has been said of late about the rather sorry state of the modern action film, and apparently the makers of 'John Wick' were paying close attention.Eschewing elaborate car chases, shaky-cam action sequences and Cuisinart editing in favor kinetic but not overly elaborate fight scenes, 'John Wick' is the blueprint for how to deliver white knuckle thrills without all the phony bologna.Also working in its favor is a simple, straightforward plot that's supplemented with some really nice world building. The cast, lead by the ever underrated Keanu Reeves, is exceptional, and really help to lift the material to another level.'John Wick' may not be art, but it doesn't aspire to be. Like its title character, its aim is true. If you're in the mood for action, he's the man for the job.

title: Well what'a you know...
content: Look, I go to the movies A LOT!!! I usually go a few times a month and I usually go by myself. We all have our own ways of relaxing and going to the flicks is mine. I've seen them all (most more than once). The way I look at it is, you have to see the bad ones to appreciated the good ones!!! I've not only walked out of the theater MANY times disappointed, but heck, I've WALKED IN many times "expecting" to be disappointed. I honestly bought my "John Wick" ticket expecting it to be a, at best, so so flick. I can't tell you how refreshing it was to be wrong. Look, I won't lie, the story is about as basic as they come, but this movie makes it work. The action is as about as CRISP as I've ever seen. The constant action, the music, the well chosen actors, along with Reeve's ever, "less is more" presence grabs you nicely and keeps you entertained. Look, don't waste your time if your looking for academy worthy material... but if your looking for a solid action flick that will keep you entertained for a few hours... this movie is definitely for you!

title: Good but not the groundbreaking action movie I was told
content: Everything says I should have liked it a lot more. But while it was a decent action flick I don't really see what the fuss is all about. Action scenes were well done indeed but not the groundbreaking work I was told. The actual plot is paper thin; I wish they had spent more time developing that whole hitmen underworld thing!

title: How bad can a movie be...
content: This is definitely one of the top 5 worst movies I have seen. The only interesting part is the first 5 minutes where you hope it's gonna be maybe a good movie. But what a disappointment you then see... And it's not that I don't like action movies. I do actually a lot. But this is just insulting my intelligence.And I am also very disappointing in IMDb. I know maybe you guys cannot do much when you have whole teams giving good reviews because they are payed for that, but it is just very sad. I know for myself that I will not really look for reviews on IMDb anymore. I also had this before, that I was wondering why does a movie have a good review on IMDb when it is bad, but kind of thought, OK, there are different tastes... But this 7+ is not different taste, it's quite an insult.Wasted 1.5h of my life.

title: John Wick
content: An ex-hit-man comes out of retirement to track down the gangsters that took everything from him.John Wick is a new action movie starring Keanu Reeves, directed by David Leitch and Chad Stahelski. Since a little while I'm a huge fan of Keanu Reeves and I watched many of his interviews; he really seems to be a very cool and down to earth gentleman. I've heard and read many positive things about John Wick. It's one of the best action movie of the year and possibly Keanu Reeves' best performance since a long time. It doesn't arcane back to the 80's action movies ,actually it's an excellent 2014 action movie, no nostalgia required. Firstly, this film blew my mind and Keanu Reeves gives a lot of himself which is such a great thing to see. He is the perfect actor for the lead role. Everything he does is cool: driving, fighting, shooting and even speaking. All those things in general are what an action hero has to do in a good action movie. He is bad ass but also as he's retired for a certain time it makes him rusty enough to produce an interesting and tensional movie. Plus, John Wick is a slick looking movie, with fantastic action scenes and most importantly and surprisingly great dialogue scenes as well. The main villain of the movie starring Michael Nyqvist (Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol and Millennium) is absolutely terrific, Russians seems to always be the bad guys. In fact all the acting on this film is really good. I think it's actually Keanu Reeves' best film since The Matrix. Mainly because this film requires a lot of an actor, it's fantastic to see him properly doing the action scenes. He knows how to sell action; but I'm not only talking about physical work, he also has some very emotional scenes which involved a lot of anger and despair; he does a very great job with all of them. The screenplay is good, it's not only a revenge/ killing movie. There been a lot of action world creation, you learn a lot about these underworld war criminal. I completely understand why the hero goes on this bloody path. I have a dog. If anyone hurts my dog for any reason I'll do John Wick on them. Plus, the Club scene is the best scene of the whole movie, it reminds me of a club scene in Collateral which is crazy good action. However, the only flaw I could see in this film is the end; as my mum would say: the end seems a little bit forced up and a little bit put together really fast. That's it. Finally, John Wick also sets up ideas of sequel (not being forced like in The Maze Runner). You are able to see the character's evolution and the potential for a franchise along the movie. John Wick's the nicest guy ever just don't screw with him.Overall John Wick has incredible shoot out sequences, it's anon-stop action movie that actually has a clever script, a really awesome hero, a great villain (a few great villains actually). It does everything an action movie is supposed to do, it understands what its doing and does it extremely well. Go see this film!

title: Decent Movie
content:
Rating: 6.4
Overall, a movie that is not so great in its own right with its lackluster direction, acting, and screenplay, but is an enjoyable watch because of its intense action scenes and character writing of John Wick (painting a character that will be fun to see what happens next to him).Pretty Bad Direction (The choreography of action sequences was very well done (Some of the best I have seen), but the moving of the story forward and the direction of actors was bad considering how dull the movie really was), Bad Acting (Pretty Good from Keanu Reeves (Able to handle the action sequences in a great way and is a strong prominent figure throughout the movie (With some good moments in dramatic acting), but has some really questionable scenes that may be in fault from the direction he was given), Acting on a Spectrum from the rest of the cast (Anywhere from very bad and emotionless (like Alfie Allen) to decent acting (like Willem Dafoe))), Good Story (Though it is filled with cliches of an ex-conman coming back into the fold, the storytelling and character writing of John Wick is very good to paint him as the ultimate figure to not be messed with), Pretty Bad to Decent Screenplay (The dialogue was very bland but there were some good moments), Score was just present (but did help in the action scenes when present), Good Cinematography, Good to Very Good Sound, Good Editing, Good Visual Effects (Especially, when showing the firefights), Good Costumes (Even though it is just a suit, they really helped create an iconic character in John Wick), Plot Structure was decent for the most part (but does follow a typical action-movie one), Pacing was incredible fast to where the runtime was very short (But this helps in giving pace to the character of John Wick), Build to climax was prevalent and noticeable in its prep for the action; climax was well executed and a fun part of the movie, Tone of the movie was very dark and grungy (adds to that John Wick feel); but there is a lot of dryness from the deadpan that it kinda takes away from this, The action scenes of the movie were some of the best choreographed action scenes I have ever seen as it is just so physical and technical that it keeps the audience engaged and wanting more.

title: Badass action movie
content: John wick is one of the most popular action gun fight movies with an amazing lead character that is very memorable and a name so iconic that a lot of people know him.The pacing is So good it's almost perfect thanks to the runtime being a little less than 2 hours which makes this movie not boring and has some great pacing without some boring filler that's a good move by the director ChadThe thing that is so good and surprising in this movie is how good the cast is , You've got the AWSOME keanu reeves and william Defoe and the two actors that I personally LOVED seeing is Ian McShane and Randall duk Kim , while those two didn't have the most screen time I loved seeing them because both of them are in one of my favorite movies (Kung fu panda ) and that's why I loved seeing those amazing voice actors in this AMAZING movieOverall this movie is done very right the pacing is very good the actor is amazing the set designs are cool and the dialogue is very good and the story is very simple yet very well written and the casting is SO good! It's an easy 9/10.

title: Slick shoot em up with stylish visuals but anorexic plot.
content: Of its genre, a quite entertaining if ultimately absurd way to spend a couple of hours of your life. Other posters have gone into the plot discrepancies before and considering there isn't really what you could call a plot then these are major flaws. The only slightly interesting plot element is the Continental hotel, a hotel for hit men (and hitwomen) where psychopathic killers can be assured a good nights sleep without fear of being attacked by other psychopathic killers. Perhaps there is a hole in the market for that sort of thing....But if you are able to overlook the films flaws you will find much to like here. It is slickly and stylishly shot, the action sequences( of which there are many )are well paced and choreographed in a style which borrows heavily from MMA, its has a strong supporting cast and even Keanu Reeves looks convincing.There is a time and a place for this sort of film and it does what it sets out to do with a degree of flair, and I for one wouldn't mind seeing more of John Wick.

title: better than johnny mnemonic
content: Well this isn't Reeve's worst film. It's probably somewhere in the middle. It reminds me a lot of those mindless 80s action films that were led by Silvester Stallone, Arnold Schwarzenegger and Chuck Norris.The plot is simple. No problem. This is an action film and there's plenty of it. Think 80s action films but with more gore and intensity. It all looks pretty too.This is supposed to be a fun movie. I get it. But it would've been nice to see more realistic gun fights that showed John Wick's using his entire repertoire of skills to take out dozens of armed gunmen instead of just showing his incredible quickness and ridiculous gun shooting accuracy.I'm not sure how this film got rated above a 7. The film looks pretty but the script is awful and the characters are uninteresting. If you want to watch an action film that's been recently released and are similar to this I suggest watching either Shooter or Olympus Has Fallen. These films are just as violent but are more interesting to watch.

title: Keanu is a bad dude!
content: Insanely action packed. Love the whole series of movies.

title: Simple and empathetic enough motivation
content: There is no tedious, sentimental scene, but only concise, understandable reason for killing them.All this movie want to show you is action.

title: Where does one begin...
content: My goodness, there I was, thinking that usually Keanu Reeves makes movies that are worth watching.In this great big pile of dreadful formulaic twaddle, full of loopholes wider than the gap between here and Mars, it appears we have a superhero who can kill 12 huge, grown men all toting sophisticated weaponry, in about a minute and yet... struggles with one tiny woman for what felt like hours, totally unable to either disarm or do away with her. Did I mention formulaic drivel? Reeves, 'the boogeyman' manages to annihilate reams of people in a revenge spree, filled with rage at the death of his wife, dog and... well, the theft of his car.The very worst soundtrack in living history. The longest nightclub fight scene in all time, no script, no acting, over dramatized, utterly dreadful dark, barely discernible scenes, quips, nothing said, nothing really accomplished, nothing worth watching.If you can't wait to watch a really bad c grade movie, yep, this'll do it for you! If you believed any of the botched reviews full of lies and hoped this might be a thinking person's crash and bash movie, don't waste a cent of your money, like I just did! GARBAGE!!!

title: Glued to the screen
content: John wick was something very fresh in an age of action movies, what I believe drove it's success and appeal to an audience that seemed to grow and grow was the hand to hand combat, John using many different fighting techniques, weapons and all of it felt and looked so real, there were so many continuing shots and it's a testament to Keanu who performed the majority of his own stunts.The story is simple, his wife passes and leaves him a dog who ends up getting killed by a Russian thug who is the son of a high up Russian mobster. Believe me when I say it's not the story we show up for, it's nice to get it and in further movies we do, but it's the action.With so many comic movies and other action movies I can't think of many that even come close to these fight scenes, Netflix Daredevil would be the closest.I enjoyed most of this movie, not to gone on the last 20 minutes to be honest but overall it's a fantastic movie.

title: Shoot 'em Up
content: There's something simple yet brilliant about the concept of a film that fills in all the gaps of our imagination and attention span, one that refuses to dilly dally with furthering plot points and ulterior motives that lead characters to do the things they do and say the things they say. 'John Wick' brings us everything we wished for from quick action, simple story, and an accessible premise--get the guys who killed my dog and stole my car. What's even more brilliant than the simple story is the style this debut director has developed almost by accident. We have excellent neo-noir cinematography, quick and witty dialogue, and grungy 90's video game rock play in our eardrums, sprinkled in with excessive gun violence and relentless kick-assery. If this first installment of a great idea doesn't fulfill your aggressive emotions, I don't know what will.

title: Keanu Is In It? Okay, I'll Watch
content: What can I say? The boyfriend loves this film, and I, like the rest of the world, love Keanu. If he's in it, I am okay with watching it. It's an okay movie. When the shooting scenes become unrealistic and excessive, I become a little ho-hum about the film. That's what happened here. Give me Speed, or give me death!! (Speed is my favorite Keanu movie.)

title: A Stunning Achievement in Action: John Wick Combines Thrilling Action Sequences with Emotional Depth
content: John Wick is a movie that has quickly become a classic in the action genre. The film stars Keanu Reeves as the title character, a retired hitman who is forced back into the game after the death of his wife and the theft of his prized possession - a vintage Mustang.One of the most impressive things about John Wick is its stunning action sequences. The choreography is impeccable, with Reeves and the stunt team pulling off some truly breathtaking moves. The fight scenes are intense and violent, but never feel gratuitous or over-the-top. They are always in service of the story, and serve to highlight the skill and determination of John Wick.But what sets John Wick apart from other action movies is its attention to detail. Every aspect of the film feels carefully crafted and considered, from the stunning cinematography to the intricate world-building. The film takes place in a unique universe where hitmen have their own currency, hotels, and rules of engagement. It's a world that feels both familiar and completely new.One of the standout performances in the film comes from Willem Dafoe as Marcus, a fellow hitman and friend of John Wick. Dafoe brings a quiet intensity to the role, and his scenes with Reeves crackle with chemistry and tension. Another standout is Michael Nyqvist as Viggo Tarasov, the film's main villain. Nyqvist plays Viggo with a quiet menace, making him a formidable opponent for John Wick.But ultimately, the film belongs to Reeves. He brings a quiet intensity to the role, conveying both the pain and determination of a man who has lost everything. His physical performance is also incredibly impressive, with Reeves performing many of his own stunts and fight scenes. It's clear that he put in a lot of work to bring John Wick to life, and it pays off in spades.One of the things that sets John Wick apart from other action movies is its commitment to world-building. The film creates a rich, complex universe that feels like it could exist outside of the confines of the film itself. From the Continental Hotel, a safe haven for hitmen, to the intricate rules that govern the world of assassins, every detail is considered and adds to the overall experience of the film.But despite its impressive world-building and stunning action sequences, what really sets John Wick apart is its emotional core. At its heart, the film is a story of love and loss, of a man driven to violence by his grief. It's a powerful and relatable story, and one that elevates the film beyond its genre trappings.Overall, John Wick is a stunning achievement in the action genre. It's a film that is both beautiful and brutal, with incredible performances and some of the best action sequences in recent memory. It's a film that deserves to be seen and celebrated, and one that will undoubtedly stand the test of time. If you haven't seen it yet, do yourself a favor and check it out.

title: A great action movie
content: This is a great action movie. The premise is as simple as it is effective: John Wick loses everything, and goes on a revenge spree. The reason why it works so well, is that the characters and the setting are both very interesting, and the action scenes are very good.The movie is set in an almost comic book like world, where there's a community of hit men and people in the underworld, with their own set of morals and code. They all use certain businesses (or services), which ties them all together. It's this universe that makes me curious for sequels to John Wick. The characters in this universe are mostly quite fun, and a lot of that owes to great casting. The way they gradually reveal John Wick's past is interesting, and it leaves you wanting to know more about who he once was.But, despite all the good things about the movie, it never elevates above its genre.

title: Fighting as dance
content: Perfects the genre of action movie by distilling it down to a tight, simple-yet-dramatic story, and expert fight choreography. Set to an entrancing soundtrack and shot in long takes. It succeeds by sticking tightly to these basic principles.

title: An alright film but loud
content: It was a good action film and I did really enjoy it, but where the action and the background music were loud the actors spoke too quietly, it was very confusing as I sometimes had to rewind scenes to hear what was going on.

title: John Wick is a standout entry in the action genre
content: I recently revisited John Wick (2014) on Netflix. The film follows a retired assassin who emerges from retirement following a devastating home invasion that results in the death of his beloved dog. Seeking vengeance, Wick hunts down those responsible, leaving a trail of destruction in his wake.Directed by Chad Stahelski (known for the John Wick series), the film features a stellar cast including Keanu Reeves (The Matrix), Willem Dafoe (Spider-Man), John Leguizamo (Spawn), Ian McShane (Deadwood), Alfie Allen (Game of Thrones) and David Patrick Kelly (The Warriors).For fans of the action genre, John Wick is a feast for the senses. Reeves shines as the stoic yet relentless hero, while Leguizamo and McShane deliver captivating supporting performances. Dafoe's presence adds an extra layer of intrigue to the narrative. The film sets up its backstory and circumstances effectively, and the action sequences are nothing short of spectacular. With well-choreographed fight scenes and impressive gore, the film keeps audiences on the edge of their seats. The intense shootouts are executed with precision, making it easy to rally behind the protagonist in his quest for justice. Plus, the film boasts a memorable soundtrack that complements the adrenaline-pumping action.In conclusion, John Wick is a standout entry in the action genre, earning a solid 7.5-8/10 rating and a strong recommendation.

title: Hypnotized somewhat
content: Need to make a John wick on how he became John wick for real ,the younger years......epic money!!!!!!

title: totally boring and utterly ridiculous movie
content: though i usually enjoy more movies where there is a delicate balance between substance and style - the film has an intelligent story and characterization that produces deep emotions, too - i also find great and perhaps a little guilty pleasure watching action films once in a while but this is one of the films in its genre in which i simply do not find anything enjoyable or pleasurable at all. it is totally boring and utterly ridiculous watching experience and i only wonder why on earth it was ever even made in the first place? there is NOTHING original. everything has been seen hundreds of times in hundreds of other movies...the characters are silly the story is totally predictable almost in every turn and there is absolutely no humor which may be the worst thing of all: all the people concerned producing this piece of stupid crap take themselves so damn too seriously and that is the most apparent source of yawn breaking boredom most viewers must feel at it. it is just another stupid piece of dull action cinema.keanu reeves who is still a sight for most female and many male sore eyes even in his fifties cannot save it (i think quite few women would have the overwhelming interest to watch the film despite its handsome protagonist). reeves as a retired professional hit man is as irritating cardboard character as anything else in the film. for most male viewers it is still enough if you slaughter a hundred guys around you with a relevant weapons arsenal and sprinkle blood on the walls in endless killing euphoria while on your vengeance tour de force but that kind of treatment when consistent all the way from the beginning to the end rarely makes a very good action movie. there must be something more.i admit that south koreans who are the real masters of the action genre nowadays have sometimes managed to do a fair movie from the scratch but this film crew has not been able to do so.total waste of time.

title: Great action movie
content: I'm watching this movie for the first time in 2021, and I loved it. They kill his dog, he kills hundreds for revenge. What more do you need in an action movie? Good old 80's style.

title: The return of Keanu
content: Keanu returns in full force. After many bad movies he returned to what he's good at. Taking a simple movie and working with a director who understands action. The thing I love the most is the long takes compared to quick cuts in the taken movies during fight scenes.

title: Boring despite the violence.
content: So much violence for nothing. He can kill more than Stalonne and Schwarzenegger together.

title: Satisfying film.
content: Everything was in good place. We had Action, drama and comedy in one gold movie. Emotions while watching this film were incredible. I've seen some action movies in my life, and this one is for sure one of the best I could watch. In short I can recommend this movie to every one, because if you are looking for the movie of action with deep story about our protagonist, but also don't want to know everything about his life then you, my friend are at a good place. Because even if he doesn't have life that look like life of a regular person, he have normal human emotions and motives. What can I say, if you want to know if I'm telling the truth then better watch it yourself.

title: aesthetic and violent
content: As John Wick: Chapter 2 is on screens and gets unexpected good reviews and not only from fans, I thought that it's a good opportunity to see the first and original John Wick which also received some positive echos, much above what is typically delivered for a film in its genre. It's certainly a matter of setting expectations, but I personally was not disappointed. If violent action movies are one of the genres that entertain you, good chances that you will not be disappointed either.Rule #1 to enjoy such a film is to accept the conventions of the genre. The story takes place in the parallel universe of the crime underworld. Although bodies start to accumulate in piles pretty soon, there is no policeman in view with the exception of one cop showing up at one point, looking at the scene of the carnage and wishing good evening to the hero who happens to be a professional killer. This parallel universe is not lawless, it's just that the laws or better said the rules are different. There is a code of honor, there are territories of neutrality, and there is only one punishment - death - for breaking rules or trespassing borders. At the roots of the story stands a failed tentative by the main hero to break the cycle of violence of his profession and jump in the universe of normal people. All this is just memories when the action starts. This film is for Keanu Reeves what 'Jack Reacher' is for Tom Cruise and I suspect that at some point even taking the name of the hero as a title is not a coincidence. It's the start of a series and the second installment was not too late to come.Assuming you bought into the story and the convention, there is some good stuff to enjoy. Stuntman Chad Stahelski is sitting for the first time on the film director chair and he delivers exactly what is expected - a coherent story telling and perfect choreography of the many action scenes that occupy more than half of the duration of the movie. Keanu Reeves delivers what is expected, and a few other fine actors show up in small and even smaller supporting roles. Cinematography is just beautiful, with combinations of dark colors that fit well the violent dark universe that they populate. If you can just forget how sketchy the whole story (or pretext) of the film is, you have good reasons to enjoy it.

title: Essentially a slick revenge action cartoon
content: It's a human revenge action cartoon set in the 2010s in New York City and New Jersey. It follows a former hitman, John Wick (Keanu Reeves), for the Russian Mafia, who left the criminal life to marry Helen (Bridget Moynahan) a little over five years previously. Helen dies of a fatal disease but bequeaths a little beagle puppy to aid in his grief. However, Iosef Tarasov (Alfie Allen), the son of Russian Mafia leader Viggo Tarasov (Michael Nyqvist), has an encounter with Wick that ends in Iosef stealing Wick's prize car, killing the beagle, and injuring Wick.This incident draws Wick into revenge mode that, by some counts, results in 80 deaths--77 of them by John Wick. Some of the more interesting characters he engages with include fellow assassin Ms. Perkins (Adrianne Palicki), former mentor and expert sniper Marcus (Willem Dafoe, and Viggo Tarasov's attorney, Avi (Dean Winters). By the end of this movie, Dean Winters looks a lot like his character in the mayhem insurance ads.One can only describe "John Wick" as a cartoon. The body count (more than one every two minutes), the accuracy of Wick's shooting, the superficial character development, the limited plot, and the breakneck action after a soulful introduction all suggest a cartoon. Keanu Reeves acts and looks like a decent anti-hero. Despite all the violence, there is surprisingly little blood. The body count apparently goes up in all the subsequent Wick movies, so one of these might be enough. It was entertaining for one time, though.

title: Template for how to make a great action movie!
content: Who would've thought a movie about someone taking revenge for their dog, would lead to one of the best action franchises of all time?Rewatching the first one after all this time, John Wick isn't as badass here as he is in later entries. He survives a lot because the antagonist don't simply kill him or because his friend saves him. It also ends weirdly with a one on one fight with an old man.Nevertheless, it is still a terrific action movie with memorable action sequences such as the house and the club shoot-out. Keanu was also a great casting choice!This should be a template for how to make a great action movie!

title: Don't waste your time
content: Shitty movie. Honestly, after the first 20 minutes, I had to turn if off. Really? Killing a dog? Was that necessary? Also, it hurt my ears to hear the TERRIBLE Russian being spoken by the "bad dudes", and the guys who play the gang members aren't even Russian for god sakes. And as a Russian, I gotta say I am also incredibly sick of Hollywood literally ALWAYS using Russians as the "bad guys". Change it up for once. Keanu Reeves has played the same character- even if different movies- for the last several years. Blah blah, revenge, ex-hit-man, blah blah, good guy versus bad guys, blah blah blah. Hollywood movies these days are all identical and lack originality. Save your time and watch something older, like an action movie from the 80s and 90s.

title: Easily the best balls out action film in along time.
content:
It's really good. It's a bit like the crow in away he only kills bad people you don't have to feel bad.
Wick actually goes out of his way by not killing certain former colleagues.
Excellent use of music and great to see Ian mcshane.
Excellent performance all around.
It's easily the best film in the John Wick franchise.

title: Great ACTION Film
content: I have no earthly idea why people want this to be anything else than it is supposed to be - it is an endless shoot em' out. It is unashamed of this, it boldly pronounces this. It is pure action incarnate, like the movie 300. If you're looking for something deep, look elsewhere.This is not to say that there is no plot - the story fits in (and thought-out the sequels) nicely enough. This should be seen in light of the other movies, as a collection or part of one panoramic picture. In doing so, you will unearth the plot which I will not be spoiling here.If you're sick of what one would stuggle to call a "storyline" in modern movies, this is great break from that. It is akin to The Northman, one of these gems or an 'out' for the typical trash in circulation.Keanu Reeves plays his part excellently. Cold, ruthless, and original. In fact, compared to other classic action films like the Transporter, his style has a bit more "realism" to it. With a rigid repeatable technique, he kills his enemies.My real rating for this is an 8.

title: A Great B movie on a mainstream market
content: Aahhh, it took me a while to watch this movie, because it looks like just another bad action flick, the poster is not helping either. I love films, from foreign, docs,festival to the Hollywood blockbusters of all genres. I hunt for certain directors, and I do love intellectual films or some might call them art flicks. But the genre that I do miss is the action trash ( grind house films ) In the glory days of VHS, many films were released only for the VHS market. Many of those are the simple, dirty action films, some are bad and some are so bad it's great. Well..John Wick reminds me of that. No BS, revenge films.If you are aware of the Charles Bronson's Death wish, John wick has a similar idea. Recently I am very happy with what Liam Neeson does ( Taken 1,2 and A walk among tombstone )John wick has similar feel . Don't expect Cannes films or look for holes, this is, like I said a B movie on a mainstream market. Great ride, shoot'em up midnight snack ( only if those seedy cinemas still around )

title: Great Movie
content: John Wick is a well made movie with good acting, visual effects, and sound design. Although the concept of its plot is a bit stupid, it was able to expound on it and make it less shallow by giving it more background and motive. One of the best aspects is its acting. The movie's action scenes were well made, and the actors chosen to fit these roles performed well in these scenes. This, combined with well done visual effects and sound design, kept the audience on the edge of their seats. But despite this, the concept the plot is based of is quite shallow. Though the writers gave it more background and motive in an attempt to expound on the concept, their efforts are unable to fully mask its flaws in the plot.For me, this movie was able to differentiate itself from most of the other action films that I have watched. What made the movie stick out for me was its ability to take a generally predictable plot formula and expound on it. Although storyline is not the movie's strongest points, thee film's writers were able to mask the concept and change the sequence "formula" to make it less predictable and more interesting.

title: Yeah, I'm Thinking Keanu Reeves Is Back!
content: American cinema has been continually producing very bland and forgettable action movies (The Equalizer serves as a recent exampleâ does anyone even remember that movie?). This year's earlier martial arts showcase, The Raid 2, easily beats out everything else from the genre's crop, and that is especially including the Marvel/superhero movies that are more about spectacular set pieces than innovative, fascinating action choreography. Well, maybe the American Kung-Fu fan/renowned action star is the best chance we have at an effective American action film at this point."People keep asking if I'm back; yeah, I'm thinking I'm back!" Keanu Reeves returns to staple badassery as John Wick who has recently lost his wife to cancer. After the painful funeral, he unexpectedly receives a delivery package at his doorâa final gift from his wife in order to help ease his grief: a cute, little dog. Of course, trouble never ceases to find Wick and after unintentionally pissing off a group of Russian mobsters at a gas station, they give him an unpleasant visit where he witnesses the murder of his dog and suffers a brutal beating. Oh, it's on! Little do those guys know who they're messing withâa bogeyman who has even spooked the mob boss into beating some sense into his culprit son and letting him know what exactly he has done. John Wickâwith his deadly skills teased and his true background mysteriousâ readies his weapons, and pure ruthless revenge ensues from there on out.The movie accomplishes just what American action cinema fails at every time. The action sequences are filmed with the use of astonishing cinematographyâplenty of wide shots to perfectly display everything that transpires on-screen without confusing the audience. The camera invariably gives us a good layout of the particular environment, which is followed by John Wick's clever utilization of those surroundings to break bones and rupture skulls. In fact, the film is so embellished with glitzy style that even its subtitles come all vibrantly colored with a catchy font and ingenious screen placement.The majority of the film is set at nighttime, and thus, we get that metropolitan vibe along with a dusky color paletteâan alluring greenish/bluish hue. In addition, a groovy, cool soundtrack incessantly complements the impressive action sequences; the best segment taking place in a violet-lit, intensely-staged night club as guns blaze and dubstep drowns out the screams. And despite Keanu Reeve's transparently limited acting range, this tough-as-nails role certainly plays to his strengths with the intimidating monotone one-liner delivery and that never-ending, rigid look of sheer ire.Unlike The Raid 2 however, there's no compelling narrative to give the film's duration any necessity to continue. John Wick simply comprises one action scene after another. Unfortunately, the combat gets repetitive fairly quicklyârepeating wrestling techniques (choke holds, etc.) and blowing brains out with the same up-close strategyâand it honestly feels like the plot struggles with where to proceed next. "Oh, I need to kill this guy, and now I have to kill this other guy in another location." The story essentially follows this formula and hopes that the viewers find that adequate enough for non-stop entertainment. An hour in though, it clearly begins to drag and doesn't show any sort of storytelling restraint in terms of when enough is enough, which is the same issue The Equalizer shared.If this high-octane extravaganza was only slimmed down by thirty minutes, it would've made for a far more satisfying and memorable experience, but I just can't say that John Wick even compares to the consistent mastery The Raid 2 boasted. This one has its fair share of cheesy, awkward moments (albeit with intention) but also just overall shallowness. With that being said, beholding the first hour alone makes it worth seeing over every American action movie this year (I still don't know if that says a lot about the staleness of the genre nowadays, or if I should just accept that John Wick surely possesses stunning quality?).

title: Absolutely awesome!
content: Awesome overload!!! I love this movie the most out of all the John Wick sequels. It's fast moving, intense, epic and did I mention just awesome?!

title: Brilliant fight sequences mixed with some painfully bad scenes
content: I am a big Keanu Reeves fan. I was looking forward to this movie and for the most part I was watching it with a huge smile on my face.The action is brilliant. Reeves does some original stuff in his fight sequences and makes them look believable.But there were several scenes which took the movie down a few pegs in my opinion. Keanu's super tough character John Wick struggling to take down a girl who looks more like she should be selling perfume than she would be capable of fighting and killing? Sorry, this is not remotely believable.John Wick getting caught and needing to be saved time and again throughout the film? How amateurish. Watch the Bourne trilogy instead. Bourne never made the mistake of letting anyone know where he was, which is why he was always a step ahead of his pursuers. If he ever got picked up he'd planned it in advance so as to attain information. By contrast John Wick continually blundered into situations that would have seen his end in an even half way real world.But the fight scenes were original and awesome. Oh yeah, and regarding Keanu's acting being terrible, which is what I've read from others here on the discussion board and in reviews: he cries when he reads his wife's letter and he makes it look more believable than most actors I've seen dealing with similar emotional scenes. His acting was great.So, will you walk away from this film considering it a masterpiece? Not if you like a decent amount of believability and logic in your story lines.But is John Wick worth watching? Yes, if only for the fight scenes...I may even buy it on Blu Ray just for those moments.

title: What's all the fuss about?
content: I saw this movie- can't say I loved it or hated it. It was "passable." What baffles me is how many people seem to love this film. There are much better films out there that do the same story...why latch on to this one? Keanu is used wisely- meaning he doesn't say much. The supporting actors are all great, but they're not given much to do.The choreography is "passable." It seemed to be that this was the only reason the movie exists, and in that case, I'd say it's a bit of let-down. It starts off great, but it doesn't really go anywhere...plateaus early.The cinematography is very good, and the music is appropriate.Like I said, a passable film, but I couldn't find anything that stands out here- Payback, Taken, and Borne Identity all do it better.

title: Simply awful
content: First time making a review here and this movie made me to do so. This Movie has nothing at all. A guy is shooting dozens of people one by one. Thats it !What I will suggest that start movie, watch for no more than 10 minutes by expecting somethings then close your eyes and go deep sleep. Don't forget to switch sound at lowest, lots of shooting will bother your sleep.I have nothing to add for this empty movie, it doesn't deserve to get more to say.But IMDb wants me to add more lines.

title: Gun guys rejoice!
content: Have you found yourself watching a movie with your wife and constantly correcting the characters onscreen for either poor gun safety or firing hundreds of bullets without a mag change? I'm proud to introduce the John Wick series, films in which both the actors and producers take firearms seriously, and it shows. Plot aside (which, as a dog owner I can't ignore) it's still an awesome movie.

title: Now THIS is a classic.
content: No Oscars? Not even one? Sure it's pretty violent, but if you merge Hacksaw Ridge and Saving Private Ryan (Best Picture nominees), you can probably get the same amount of violence. Maybe. And Keanu Reeves has one helluva performance, from his amazing action seems he probably did himself, and his Russian dialogue that makes no sense without context (and maybe a little less with). Also, I didn't know Willem Defoe was in the movie before a watched it. If he had more words to say, that could've been Oscar worthy. Ooh, and that ending? And then the next ending after that? Top notch.That doesn't count as spoilers, and if it does, why haven't you watched the movie.

title: [7.3] Drowned
content: Aside the bright fight/action scenes, that's an empty movie with a simplistic screenplay, below-average logic, as deep as a home aquarium and a clichÃ©d ending.You simply don't care (too much) about the main character and his reasons to start all that bloodshed. It's easy on the eye, somehow entertaining, no more.The minuses of the movie strongly prevail over the pluses. There is intensity, yes, but John Wick lack of charisma, the dismal logic of the movie combined with an average storyline render the movie just as a mindless generic action movie.Bullets and fighting abilities alone don't make a movie great, if there's no soul to it and John Wick, the first chapter, has its soul drowned a long time ago.Screenplay/story: 6Direction/development: 8Realism: 8Entertainment: 9Acting: 7.5Cinematography/filming: 9Visuals/special effects: 9Sound/score: 8.5Depth: 5Logic: 4Flow: 8Action/thriller: 7.5Ending: 6.

title: Delivered
content: Delivered exactly what it promised, "INSANE ACTION". Actually think, what movie delivers better action. None!

title: He's back
content: WowI loved this film, Mr Reeves is great in this film, i love all the crime/gangster films anyway, although it might not go down as one of the greats it is still in its own rite a great film.Loads of action, revenge, fighting, killing....what more would you need in a movies.Glad to see Mr Reeves back on the big screen in a good action role once again.Please please watch this film it's really really good.Enjoy

title: John Wick the boogeyman
content: I have just watch John Wick part 1 and search the entry and the feature fight stories sometime thanvika but its action is recover these part.

title: Storytelling is Good Copying
content: All the below are non-creative copying of past movies (done many times before): 1. Opening scene - alarm clock going off. 2. Coffee brewing. 3. Casket being lowered; raining for effect; long shot of cemetery showing stranger watching. 4. Afterwards, solemn wake party. 5. Mystery package at door. From? Of course. 6. Bad guys are (Guess what nationality?) $1000 if you have no idea. And, of course, are as stereotypic as cut-out doll figures. 7. Older hot cars and lots of squealing tires, burning rubber (or synthetic equivalent). You would think Reeves character would be past that 17 year old's infatuation. 8. Master killer still has an arsenal hidden away, why? Anticipated this precise series of events unfolding many years earlier. Or, nostalgia. 9. Reeves is covered in tats, of course, to show us toughness. Russian iconic tats no less - oops! 10. Dozen (cheaper that way) bad guys need some skill training because they're slow, dumb and can't seem to shoot at a target a few feet away and always walk around corners without looking first. 11. Been done before "cleaning crew" just a call away to dispose of waste animal tissue (human of course). They always look the same in these movies. 12. Usual cheap scene filler, and getting really tedious, helicopter shot of city and car traveling on road below (even did a several times). 13. Background music the usual rock/blues/alter/jazz sound. 14. Barely clothed chicks tossed in for the male viewer and one to be bad. 15. Same old club scenes with strobes. 16. Usual wharf/dock driving and shooting scenes. 17. Now for the fun part and a new record surpassing the past record of 65 kills by one individual in a movie (can't remember the movie from a couple of years ago but it had that Detroit blighted semi-deserted projects, public housing/towers backdrop with this guy going through the floors shooting all the druggies). The new record for a movie is (drum roll) 73 by Reeves and 8 by others = 81 (maybe more, hard to keep track at times).

title: Great movie
content: As a fan of action movies and Keanu Reeves all I have to say is well this film is incredible and very cool and intense and everything good a film should be and the stunts and acting are very good and you totally get behind the main character even though this film is a couple years old it absolutely still holds up today I highly recommend anyone who wants a very good and tense action thriller this is the movie for you and I can't wait to watch the rest of the series and and I can totally see why this film was such a hit when it first came out back in 2014 This is how you make an action movie good And interesting.

title: Fast and furious solo
content: James Bond, Jack Bauer, Jason Bourn, Jack Reacher, John Carter, and now John Wick - writers do seem to have limited imaginations when it comes to the names of their action heroes. JW is a retired assassin and we all know that, in the movies, it doesn't take much to bring a man with "a very particular set of skills" back into the game. Kidnapping his daughter usually does it but, if you want to be sure, kill his dog. This really makes Wick (Keanu Reeves back on cracking form) mad. Of course, we knew who the bad guys were even before their mistake with the mutt because they speak Russian and the subtitles are presented in comic book style to add to the fun.There's minimal plot but maximum action in this film directed by Chad Stahelski (Keanu's stunt double in "The Matrix") and David Leitch (another veteran stunt coordinator). Wick is not out simply to disable his foes but instead never leaves death in doubt and he is no silent assassin but absolutely litters the screen in bodies in a riot of action and noise that somehow escapes the notice of the New York Police Department. According to those who count these things, the original "Taken" movie clocked up a body count of 35 but Wick racks up a much superior 76.I saw the movie on an IMAX screen so I was both shaken and stirred.

title: A kick-ass action which will pump up your adrenalin
content: One thing I noted while watching John Wick was its simple story told with fascinating execution and commendable action scenes, and that is the beauty of this film which was over-stretched in the climax but was saved by outstanding script.John Wick is an ex-hit-man who comes out of his retirement in search of a mafia's son who was responsible for killing his dog, the last gift sent by his late wife.First time directors, Chad Stahelski and David Leitch did pretty well in shaping the movie to be a blunt and taut revenge action-packed thriller. The movie takes sometime to build on but when it does , there is no turning back. Each scene is beautifully depicted with rocking background score and applauding dialogues. It gives an holistic view of gangland and rules they live in and high respect for each other. Icing on the cake is the well-choreographed action scenes which has been executed brilliantly with graphic bloodshed looking like a PC game. Script is tight and will keep you engaged. The flip-side is unnecessary inclusion of climax scenes which could be easily be edited. Keanue Reeves is back in form and I loved him after long time especially post Matrix series. He does well in dialogues delivery and will be appreciated for his acting.Overall, a kick-ass action which will pump up your adrenalin. Good 3/5

title: Amazing!
content: Keanu Reeves is not a man to mess with especially after this film where most of all the stunts you see with guns in the movie are all his real skills like wow!!

title: Solid Action But Without Substance
content: I love a good revenge story. There is about these kind of tales we can get behind, choose a side, and that's usually enough to justify the violence in most movies nowadays. John Wick is a revenge story, and on merits of it's action scenes a pretty amazing ride. However where it excels in quick paced action it certainly leaves a lot to be desired in story.John Wick is a well to do man in his 30's, seemingly wealthy, and in love. His wife is beautiful and she has a way of making him whole, but these things rarely last, and his world is about to come apart at the seems. He has a hidden past, something he isn't proud of, but it's what has given him this life of luxury and the ability to spend so much time with his wife. Shortly after the beginning of the film, in which we find our main character badly wounded, we enter a series of flashbacks where we learn his wife had become ill to some unknown disease, and he has very little time to process this loss. As events unfold, John returns to his old ways, on a killing spree against new foes and some old ones as well.The story that unfolds isn't great by any means, but there are some real amazing action sequences of such military precision that they are a pleasure to watch. Keanu Reeves underwent 4 months of firearms training and it really shows through his work. Some of the best action sequences are the close quarters hand to hand combat, where John Wick used a lot of Japanese Jujitsu, but incorporates his firearm in so many of the moves (slightly reminiscent of the film Equilibrium 2002). Although some might be turned off by the level of violence and high body count, this is really why you watch a movie like this.Unfortunately the plot itself is so outrageously thin and badly written that it kind of ruins the whole thing for me. When I think of the classic revenge story, a few titles come to mind right away. Oldboy (2013) or Django Unchained (2012) for example. The main characters of these films are men obsessed with revenge, and you can easily understand why the characters would go to such lengths to get back at the people who have done wrong by them. This is what John Wick is missing, I couldn't understand why a man would throw his life away for the memory of someone who is already dead. He goes up against an army of Mafioso's and leaves bodies all over the city, and anyone who gets in his way is a dead man... but why? I couldn't grasp that concept in this film, and it left me so unsatisfied and crying in disbelief.So, it does have some of the best fire fights I've seen in a film, and excellent hand to hand choreography (Michael Nyqvist nearly lost an ear!), but the whole premise of the movie kind of fell flat in my eyes. But I hear this is the first in a trilogy so they have lots of room to improve story line in the future.6/10

title: One of the most praised action movies of all time.
content:
John Wick..
One of the most praised action movies of all time...One of the defining traits of John Wick is his commitment to efficiency; he moves with tactical precision to waste no movement and often kills his target without giving them room for any ceremonious last words before their demise. Keanu Reeves deserves immense credit for his dedication to tactical training and personal fitness to ensure that he does the vast majority of his own stunts, which is evident in the final product. Few actors are able to do what he does on screen, and even fewer are able to make cohesive action stories that effectively display the mastery of that craft. That dedication to making every second count is palpable in the pacing of the films.

title: This guys pretty cold
content: I can't honestly say that this was the soulless action movie i expected. Obviously this movie is super straightforward, predictable and for the most part emotionless that's not to say it was bad. If anything it was kinda refreshing to see some non stop action that was done really well.Like on its 20 million dollar budget it had better action sequences than 90 percent of marvel movies. The preformances are kind kf what you'd expect from this type of movie. No career topping ones but no real bad ones either. title: John Wick is one of the best action movies of all time
content: John Wick is not a regular action film, its a film that has a lot of technical dimensions which are very wrong to be ignored, some people maybe sees it as a normal action movie like any other action movie, without a beginning or end or story, but what is the interpretation of these proposals ? They are nothing more than subjective opinions which we can't rate a work based on them. So what makes this film great ?There are 3 reasons:1 - The special new story and what it contains from expressions that describe the situation of the exhausting, retired and regrettable human and the most important is the lonely, and what it means to live inside this shell.2 - While watching the film we touch the summary of the achievements of action films between its scenes, is not a classic film but it has a classic taste is not a film entirely modern but it has a modernity taste, cause its scenes take us on a journey of suspense inside two stages mixed in one new stage I can't name it but John Wake's stage.3 - Fighting scenes, the way its been filmed and the operating of the camera, its very hard to explain this point or to explain the feeling that sends by it but I can say that the fighting style is not just a simple style like any other action film but its much more than that, not because he can kill 100 men during 5 minutes but I think the director wanted the fighting scenes to be like a video game regarding the movies and the camera operating way, because the audience feels exactly like he's/she's in front of fighting chapter in a game and they should pass it and they can't leave the controller just waiting the next hit to see where its gonna come, until they forget that they are watching a movie not a video game and that because of the intensity of the scene and how strongly it attracting the eye and the adrenaline.John Wake film raised action movies to a higher stag.

title: John Wick (2014)
content:
John Wick (Keanu Reeves) is a widower who receives a final parting gift from his recently deceased wife. A companion in a form of a puppy who he was informed to cherish as he grieves alone. Coincidentally crossing paths with three sadistic men who threaten to tear down his world. John reverts back to the previous life that he dutifully tried to leave behind in order to begin anew. Carefully unveiled to be the most ruthless assassin to have ever lived known as Baba Yaga, The Boogeyman. John seeks to settle the score with the memory of his loved one as fuel to the fire.Despite the familiar premise, John Wick is more than just an average vengeance tale. The focus is centered on a broken individual who desperately wants to hold onto what is most valuable to him. Dos vidanya, to anyone who tries to take what does not rightfully belong to them. Keanu Reeves gives a tour-de-force performance as the titular character. Encapsulating all of the emotional drive and vulnerability of a man who simply has nothing to lose. Quite unfortunate that Reeves' career was on a nose-drive before his initiation into the franchise. This film not only revitalized his career but showcases his talent as Reeves' had performed 95% of his own stunts for the outstanding action sequences in the film. Making the character his own that is now adored by fans of the action genre. John Wick is a powerhouse introduction for what has been deemed as one of the greatest action-oriented franchises of all time. The lore is simply fascinating as there is another world going on that is invisible to the naked eye with all members using a unique transaction system, bearing tattoos and assassinating for hire. Abiding by certain rules that must never be crossed. The sound design including the tracks "Killing Strangers" by Marilyn Manson, "Think by Kaleida", and "Who You Talkin' to Man?" by Ciscandra Nostalghia, set the atmosphere
in this tale about a stylistic dark underworld.IG: thecinephilereviews.

title: John Wick is great
content: Hello, I want to express my opinion about the movie John Wick. Personally, Keanu Reeves' movies are my favorite movies and Keanu Reeves is also my favorite actor. When I watched the movie John Wick, he immersed me in his story and The last minute of the movie kept me, this movie was really great and awesome, and one of the things that make this movie awesome is Keanu Reeves' great acting and acting, he made the action and the story in the best possible way and makes you want to watch it. Movie Don't get tired, I can boldly say that the best actor for me is none other than Keanu Reeves. I suggest you watch the movie.

title: The action is so smooth and stylish.
content: I'm watching through all the John Wick movies again before I see Chapter 4. John Wick is about a man, a retired ex-hitman, who loses his wife. He gets a puppy as a last gift from his wife after she dies. Then his car is stolen and his dog is killed by some gangsters. Now John Wick is angry. Now John Wick wants revenge. Then the rest of the movie is filled with revenge seeking action. It's almost like one long action scene.It is a very entertaining action style. The gunfights are very stylish and innovative. His gun really feels like an extension of his arm. He is so confident with his gun. One would almost like to have a rating displayed and upgraded after every kill he makes. Like in the video game franchise Devil May Cry! The action is so smooth and stylish. I was so entertained by this movie, but I feel it has the potential to be even more stylish and entertaining, so it is good that there are sequels!Final stylish rating: B+

title: Maybe not my taste..
content: I believe action movies are not quite my thing, as most Hollywood action is generic these days. John Wick the latest one I saw, is overall quite similar to another recent action flick The Equalizer. One retired specialist is brought back in action to destroy an entire mafia gang. It may entertain hardcore action lovers, but for me its utter boredom. At least, The Equalizer was backed up with some story, which is almost absent here. John Wick is an ex-hit-man who had retired to leave peacefully with his wife. Unfortunately she dies o cancer and all John Wick is left with is his super-cool Mustang and the dog his wife leaves as a gift. But John is pulled back into the action when his car is stolen and dog killed by the mafia head's son. Driven by grief and revenge he decides to take down the people involved using his super-hit-man skills.
